results.title: Art in the western world
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: Treasures from the National Gallery of Art in Washington are used to present the development of Western art from the thirteenth century. The film opens with a discussion of Byzantine and early Italian painting and explains the gradual development of realism during the Renaissance. The work of famous artists such as Velasquez, Rembrandt, Van Eyck and Goya illustrate the development of art up to the nineteenth century. The film concludes with examples of French Impressionism and Post Impressionism.

results.title: Art in Australia
results.brief_description: Melbourne is an art conscious city, the centre of which is the National Gallery, housing many old masters and other works of art. The film shows the contribution to this interest in art being made by the annual Dunlop Art Contest. The film shows some of the work involved in the unpacking, cataloguing and judging of the hundreds of entries from all over Australia, and concludes with views of the 1951 winning entries with comments on each by the judges. No other credits available.

results.title: Art images in jazz
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Tadeusz Strak and Zbigniev Rybozynska
results.brief_description: An animated film set to the music of jazz, employing various animated techniques and a broad range of colour and design.

results.title: Art from found materials
results.brief_description: Many artists use ‘found materials’ with imagination. They use such natural things as seeds and shells as well as scrap materials. Both collage and assemblage are illustrated. The materials used, their organisation, and techniques for adhering offer endless possibilities for creative form and images. No other credits available.

results.title: Art for everybody
results.brief_description: The function of an art gallery in the community. Sequences show the variety of interests a gallery can hold for people - exhibitions of great art from many nations, festivals of dancing and music. Even more important is the part a gallery can play in the development of imagination and talent in a child. Through happy participation in painting, modelling activities, costume-making and pageants, children learn about art.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.

results.title: Art by Bruce Petty
results.brief_description: Cartoonist Bruce Petty turns his acid wit and frenetic graphics to the subject of art. A montage of images questions the nature of art appreciation and the relationship between art and life. Filmed in the Indianapolis Museum of Art.

results.title: Art Blakey: The Jazz Messengers
results.brief_description: Recorded live in the intimate surroundings of Ronnie Scott’s Club, on the 21st February, 1985, this video features one of the finest incarnations of The Messengers yet heard - driven on as ever by the unstoppable energy of Art Blakey. The great man also talks frankly about his life, music and beliefs in an exclusive interview.

results.title: Art attack 2
results.creator_credit: Media Merchants, Television South, Tim Edmunds, Neil Buchanan and Nick Bigsby
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration. Be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode topics covered include cartooning - learn how to draw animal caricatures and different cartoon bodies, and splash out with splash art - learn how to brighten up dull clothes.

results.title: Art attack
results.creator_credit: Media Merchants, Television South, Tim Edmunds, Neil Buchanan and Nick Bigsby
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration - be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode you can learn how to make a pastry face mask, create your very own ancient treasure map, and design a poster out of your name.
